Title: APC chieftain urges Fubara to sack Ibas’ appointees
Summary: APC chieftain urges Governor Siminalayi Fubara to sack Ibas’ appointees . Eze Chukwuemeka Eze has advised Governor to sack all appointees installed during the tenure of the former Sole Administrator, Ibok-Ette Ibas. Eze, who previously served as the

Title: Police arrest gang leader disguising as security personnel, others in Lagos
Summary: Police arrest a gang of vehicle vandals and their leader, Jude Onuoha . The gang leader is notorious for disguising himself as a security personnel .

Title: Troops intercept trailer containing supplies for terrorists in Yobe
Summary: Troops of the Nigerian Army intercepted a large cache of logistics supplies concealed in a trailer in Yobe State on Tuesday . In a statement, Lieutenant Colonel Sani Uba said the trailer contained supplies for terrorists .

Title: FCT resident doctors suspend strike after Senate, Wike’s intervention
Summary: The Association of Resident Doctors under the Federal Capital Territory Administration (ARD-FCTA) has suspended its indefinite strike . ARD President, Dr. George Ebong, confirmed on Friday that members would not go on strike .

Title: 148 Nigerian migrants repatriated from Sudan
Summary: 148 Nigerians returned from Sudan on Thursday, the National Emergency Management Agency said . NEMA said it facilitated the return of the migrants . The returnees were received by the agency .

Title: London’s Heathrow, other European airports hit by cyberattack
Summary: At least 10 flights cancelled out of Brussels Airport and another 17 delayed by over an hour . Brussels Airport's system was hit by a "cyberattack" overnight on Friday .

Title: NAF says airstrikes killed 25 terrorists in Borno, Yobe
Summary: NAF says airstrikes killed 25 terrorists in Borno, Yobe . The operations were conducted on September 18 following intelligence from ground troops, the Nigerian Air Force said .

Title: Guinea-Bissau opposition leader returns from exile
Summary: Guinea-Bissau has seen four coups since independence from Portugal in 1974 . The last of the last of those coups was in 2012 .

Title: 148 Nigerian migrants stranded in Sudan return home
Summary: 148 Nigerian migrants stranded in Sudan return home . NEMA confirmed that the group arrived at Malam Aminu Kano International Airport on Friday .

Title: Kwankwaso gives terms, conditions to rejoin APC
Summary: The 2023 Presidential Candidate of the New Nigeria People's Party, NNPP, Sen Rabiu Musa Kwankwaso has given terms and conditions to rejoin the All Progressives Congress, APC .
